net.jakubholy.dbunitexpress
Class DatabaseCreator

java.lang.Object
  net.jakubholy.dbunitexpress.DatabaseCreator

public class DatabaseCreator
extends Object

Utility class for initializing the embedded Derby test database. The database must be created and filled with tables needed for testing before it can be used in unit tests.

It creates a test Derby database at the default location and fills it with data structures defined in a DDL file expected at the default location DDL_FILE_PATH.

You should run this as a java console application (i.e. the main method) to create the DB.

See Also:
createDbSchemaFromDdl(Connection)

Method Detail

createDbSchemaFromDdl

public static void createDbSchemaFromDdl(Connection connection)
                                  throws FileNotFoundException,
                                         IOException,
                                         Exception,
                                         SQLException
Run a DDL on the (empty) test database to create the schemas and tables to fill with test date. The DDL is read from the file DDL_FILE_PATH.

WARNING: The code cannot handle all the stuff you may use in a DDL. More exactly everything that you can pass to Statement.execute(String) is OK, in addition to that we can handle empty lines and comment lines starting with '--'.

Parameters:
connection - (required) A connection to the test db; e.g. DatabaseTestCase.getDatabaseTester()#getConnection()#getConnection().
Throws:
FileNotFoundException - The DDL file not found
IOException - Failed to read the DDL
SQLException - Failure during execution of the DDL
Exception

main

public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Exception
Run as a java console program to create and initialize the embedded Derby DB. DB connection info is taken over from the AbstractEmbeddedDbTestCase.

To retry, simply delete the database (normally testData/testDB/).

Parameters:
args - ignored
Throws:
Exception
See Also:
createAndInitializeTestDb()

createAndInitializeTestDb

public static void createAndInitializeTestDb()
                                      throws Exception,
                                             FileNotFoundException,
                                             IOException,
                                             SQLException
Create and from a DDL initialize the embedded Derby DB. DB connection info is taken over from the AbstractEmbeddedDbTestCase (where it is hard-coded).

To retry, simply delete the database (normally testData/testDB/).

Throws:
Exception
FileNotFoundException
IOException
SQLException
See Also:
createDbSchemaFromDdl(java.sql.Connection), DDL_FILE_PATH, EmbeddedDbTester.createAndInitDatabaseTester()

loadDdl

public void loadDdl(String ddlFile)
             throws org.dbunit.DatabaseUnitRuntimeException
Load an additional DDL into the database. It can be co-located with the calling test class, on the classpath, or in the default testData/ folder.

Parameters:
ddlFile - (required) name of the ddlFile
Throws:
org.dbunit.DatabaseUnitRuntimeException
Since:
1.3.0
